intro: Capsella lanceolatocaspica, commonly known as the Caspian sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in arid and semi-arid regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive white underside, while the seeds are small and capsule-like. It is often considered a weed but has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
